reviews.review_msg: Dr. Mund was such an caring lab prof, I attended his office hours whenever the labs were proving difficult for me and he always gave me advice on how I could succeed and I took it so much to heart, I highly recommend this course to any chem or science major.

Garry is fantastic to say the least. he is so caring and genuinely wants you to succeed. if you just read the lab manual you would literally do just fine on the labs. HE IS ALWAYS THERE TO HELP AND NEVER JUDGES I GENUINELY enjoyed this class so much . if you ever see that Garry is teaching just take the class without thinking HE IS WONDERFUL
Best lab instructor I've ever had! Clear grading and feedback, and lab experiments done were not over the top complicated!

Hard to give an opinion when I don't even know what he looks like after a whole term with him as my prof. Chem125 online is pretty fend-for-yourself, but Garry was helpful and understanding, as well as quick to reply, over email. Labs are posted as PDFs, and no videos are provided of the experiment actually being done. Class average was a B-.

CHEM 125 is a pretty tough lab course for the first university-level gen chem lab, IMO. Pat close attention to sigfigs and read the lab material BEFORE the lab including the relevant appendix page. You cannot be prepared enough  If you ask for help directly from her it's better because TA's are often unsure what they're allowed to help with.
